meanings.definition: Relating to the branch of medicine that deals with mental disorders attributable to diseases of the nervous system.
meanings.sent1: The neuropsychiatrically trained doctor specializes in treating mental disorders linked to nervous system diseases.
meanings.sent2: She sought help from a neuropsychiatrically focused clinic for her anxiety disorder.
meanings.sent3: The neuropsychiatrically inclined therapist always had a unique approach to treating patients.
meanings.sent4: His neuropsychiatrically informed treatment plan was like a roadmap to understanding mental health.
meanings.sent5: The neuropsychiatrically influenced research shed light on the connection between brain health and mental well-being.

meanings.definition: In a neuropsychiatric manner; with regard to neuropsychiatry.
meanings.sent1: She observed the patient neuropsychiatrically, focusing on both neurological and psychiatric aspects.
meanings.sent2: The doctor approached the case neuropsychiatrically, considering both brain function and mental health.
meanings.sent3: He humorously remarked that he was thinking neuropsychiatrically after a long day at the clinic.
meanings.sent4: The team tackled the problem neuropsychiatrically, blending neuroscience and psychiatry.
meanings.sent5: The researcher analyzed the data neuropsychiatrically, uncovering new insights into brain disorders.
